revised_title: Interferon-Induced Fatty Acid Desaturation and its Effects on Cell Membranes
tldr: The authors discovered that interferon induces changes in the saturation of long-chain fatty acids, leading to an increase in cell membrane rigidity. This effect could be the mechanism behind interferon's ability to inhibit virus replication, increase cell membrane buoyant density, and affect other cellular processes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
